basis: The user repeatedly verbalizes adherence and willingness to follow the plan, but prior behavior shows minimal actual follow-through or inconsistent reporting. This pattern suggests a modest action level despite positive wording.
coaching_notes: Focus on concrete, tiny commitments with immediate prompts (e.g., a fixed, short window after routine, automatic reminders). Explore barriers (fatigue, heat, BED cravings) and simplify further if needed. Use accountability prompts (daily check-in, automatic logging) and reduce friction by presetting cues and pre-loading coping moves.
